## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> configuration.

A linker can configure <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> by setting fields in this data structure and passing it to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">lto::LTO</a> constructor.

Definition at line 41 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h">Config.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Typedefs

### CombinedIndexHookFn {#adfaa4b815344424627948d3bff41ad5b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>using llvm::lto::Config::CombinedIndexHookFn =  std::function&lt;bool(
      const ModuleSummaryIndex &amp;Index,
      const DenseSet&lt;GlobalValue::GUID&gt; &amp;GUIDPreservedSymbols)&gt;</>}>
A combined index hook is called after all per-module indexes have been combined (ThinLTO-specific).

It can be used to implement -save-temps for the combined index.

If this function returns false, any further processing for ThinLTO tasks is aborted.

It is called regardless of whether the backend is in-process, although it is not called from individual backend processes.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h/#l00257">257</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h">Config.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ModuleHookFn {#a2ac2a2331097ef0392e387a01a0844ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>using llvm::lto::Config::ModuleHookFn =  std::function&lt;bool(unsigned Task, const Module &amp;)&gt;</>}>
The following callbacks deal with tasks, which normally represent the entire optimization and code generation pipeline for what will become a single native object file.

Each task has a unique identifier between 0 and getMaxTasks()-1, which is supplied to the callback via the Task parameter. A task represents the entire pipeline for ThinLTO and regular (non-parallel) <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a>, but a parallel code generation task will be split into N tasks before code generation, where N is the parallelism level.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> may decide to stop processing a task at any time, for example if the module is empty or if a module hook (see below) returns false. For this reason, the client should not expect to receive exactly getMaxTasks() native object files. A module hook may be used by a linker to perform actions during the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> pipeline. For example, a linker may use this function to implement -save-temps. If this function returns false, any further processing for that task is aborted.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> hooks must be thread safe with respect to the linker&#39;s internal data structures. A module hook will never be called concurrently from multiple threads with the same task <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>, or the same module.

Note that in out-of-process backend scenarios, none of the hooks will be called for ThinLTO tasks.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h/#l00224">224</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h">Config.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### addSaveTemps() {#a4395f06e55f4b727fe0b685074821644}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error Config::addSaveTemps (std::string OutputFileName, bool UseInputModulePath=false, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/denseset">DenseSet</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> &gt; &amp; SaveTempsArgs=&#123;&#125;)</>}>
This is a convenience function that configures this <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lto/config">Config</a> object to write temporary files named after the given OutputFileName for each of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> phases to disk.

A client can use this function to implement -save-temps.

FIXME: Temporary files derived from ThinLTO backends are currently named after the input file name, rather than the output file name, when UseInputModulePath is set to true.

Specifically, it (1) sets each of the above module hooks and the combined index hook to a function that calls the hook function (if any) that was present in the appropriate field when the addSaveTemps function was called, and writes the module to a bitcode file with a name prefixed by the given output file name, and (2) creates a resolution file whose name is prefixed by the given output file name and sets ResolutionFile to its file handle.

SaveTempsArgs can be specified to select which temps to save. If SaveTempsArgs is not provided, all temps are saved.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h/#l00280">280</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h">Config.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/ltobackend-cpp/#l00088">88</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/lto/ltobackend-cpp">LTOBackend.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### KeepSymbolNameCopies {#a1ed3ed67f7ab274e3d086aa3488a3093}

### RemarksHotnessThreshold {#a3fb18e2c1449a48f3ce809e398c8496c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; llvm::lto::Config::RemarksHotnessThreshold = 0</>}>
The minimum hotness value a diagnostic needs in order to be included in optimization diagnostics.

The threshold is an Optional value, which maps to one of the 3 states:
<ul>
<li>0 =&gt; threshold disabled. All emarks will be printed.</li>
<li>positive int =&gt; manual threshold by user. Remarks with hotness exceed threshold will be printed.</li>
<li>None =&gt; &#39;auto&#39; threshold by user. The actual value is not available at command line, but will be synced with hotness threhold from profile summary during compilation.</li>
</ul>


If threshold option is not specified, it is disabled by default.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h/#l00165">165</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h">Config.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ResolutionFile {#a719ecf03772af7ca6a1a7cc1bc43c65b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;raw&#95;ostream&gt; llvm::lto::Config::ResolutionFile</>}>
If this field is set, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> will write input file paths and symbol resolutions here in llvm-lto2 command line flag format.

This can be used for testing and for running the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lto/lto">LTO</a> pipeline outside of the linker with llvm-lto2.

### SplitDwarfFile {#aa4f390c0f5cbd46df4734ccd229f36ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="std::string llvm::lto::Config::SplitDwarfFile">
The name for the split debug info file used for the DW&#95;AT&#95;&#91;GNU&#95;&#93;dwo&#95;name attribute in the skeleton <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/cu">CU</a>.

This should generally only be used when running an individual backend directly via <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lto/#ae6ff75e89240b2f2c01d3be088ca6014">thinBackend()</a>, as otherwise all objects would use the same .dwo file. Not used as output path.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="std::string llvm::lto::Config::SplitDwarfOutput">
The path to write a .dwo file to.

This should generally only be used when running an individual backend directly via <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lto/#ae6ff75e89240b2f2c01d3be088ca6014">thinBackend()</a>, as otherwise all .dwo files will be written to the same path. Not used in skeleton <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/cu">CU</a>.

### VisibilityScheme {#a901ca2ceffdd3815fd527e0d994ea4a0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>VisScheme llvm::lto::Config::VisibilityScheme = <a href="#a6df1c201fe73a270f67a7c153c42c0beab75f3c598a19a49547d5fa7456d64e1a">FromPrevailing</a></>}>
Allows non-imported definitions to get the potentially more constraining visibility from the prevailing definition.

FromPrevailing is the default because it works for many binary formats. <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a> can use the more optimized &#39;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a>&#39; scheme.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/lto/config-h">Config.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
